title: [RESOLVED] Connection Stability Issues - 10/09/2015
body:
** UPDATE:  10/9 @ 1545 AEST: ** We've identified a potential cause and made some changes to route around the issue.  If you have been having issues, can you please test again and report back if it is still problematic.


Original post:

We've been getting reports of players experiencing issues maintaining a stable connection to the league servers when in the client.  This might manifest as problems logging in, issues with matchmaking, or chat not staying connected.

We're currently collecting info on this and looking to find the root cause, and if you are experiencing this, please send an email to jimz (at) riotgames.com with the following info:

* trace route to 192.64.169.20
* your IP address (you can find this out by visiting [whatismyip.com](http://www.whatismyip.com)

Thanks for your patience in this.  We're working hard to get everything running smoothly again as our top priority.

Best Regards
Mindstar

replies.body:
We've identified a potential cause and made some changes to route around the issue. If you have been having issues, can you please test again and report back if it is still problematic.

Thanks!
Mindstar
Yeah alg thanks guys
Yes it has fixed my problems thank you :)
Thanks for letting us know!  :)
How do u do a trace and copy it never had to do one before
Copy the guy below in command prompt or there are net programs
I worked it out thanks for your help though but why do they want your IP address

The reason we ask for your IP address is that it allows us to do a trace route from our servers back to you.  

Internet traffic doesn't always take the same path in each direction (from you to the server, from the server back to you), and when there are problems like there were today, it really helps for us to be able to see both directions to find out where exactly the issue is.

GO Start 
In search type cmd
it will open up dos.
type tracert 192.64.169.20
right click and click select all then press crt x and paste it in to your email by crt v.
thanks mate

Still happening. If my internet goes down for a while ( was running ping ) I can't ping your server after that for very long time (10 + minutes). Lost 2 rankeds cause of that :/  Since I can't ping you I can't give you my trace route, but my IP is: <removed>
I just got disconnected and could not ping/login to the client for 15 mins.  So I was rather  unable to reconnect than had any stability issues.

I've noted your IP.  You should be able to perform a trace route regardless of whether you can ping the server (a lot of Riot servers don't respond to ping anyway), it just might miss the last hop or two (which is fine).

When you say you lost ranked games because of this - is this because you were unable to connect to the game itself, or because you were having issues with stability during login/matchmaking/champ select?

Mindstar

For in-game ping, you definitely shouldn't be seeing 200ms!

Also - you'll want to run a different traceroute - we have a different set of servers (in Sydney).  Try running a traceroute to 103.240.227.1.  It might be worth kicking off a different thread for that one though, as the issue here was unrelated to game servers themselves.

Cheers
Mindstar
Working well now, thanks Mindstar
I'm up and working now, thanks for the support.
the problem seems to be fixed now
